Ooops, today is my 10 years on Instagram anniversary! üò≥üë¥
‚†Ä
I could tell you now how awesome and creative the Instagram community was in the first years. It was, indeed! 
‚†Ä
But the thing is ‚Äì even though so much has changed: I‚Äôm still burning for photography, enthusiastic to capture that special moment, to master the equipment, to learn new editing skills, to travel and explore. And many other people here on Instagram do as well ‚Äì and that is inspiring.
‚†Ä
Thanks so much for following me. üôè 
‚†Ä
Here are 10 of my favorites shots out of 6.990 photos (Tokyo, Istanbul, Lisbon, Berlin, St. Petersburg, Mandalay, Hongkong, Seoul, Bangkok, Shanghai). 
‚†Ä
Cheers!
I had to buy a drone, because I saw so many inspiring photos recently ‚Äì and this is my first try. üì∑üêù

Take more photos, do less editing ‚Äì have you ever tried Fujifilm recipes?

In 2023, I rediscovered the joy of photography with what I call ‚Äögoing half-analog' ‚Äì all these photos are straight from my Fujifilm X100V camera, no edits. Using Fujifilm ‚Äörecipes' helped me set the style beforehand, so no need for long post-processing.

If you own a Fujifilm camera or plan to buy one: I wrote an article about Fujifilm recipes for @mpbcom on how to use them and which are my favourites ‚Äì check the link in my bio. If you have any more questions, drop them in the comments. 

Have a great 2024, may all your wishes come true. üôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Win a Fujifilm X100V Camera ‚Äì read till the end. üòé

Let me share a story behind these #Berlin TV Tower photos: They were all taken with my old, affordable telephoto lens (Sony 70-300 G OSS). 

Later on, I upgraded to a high-end telephoto lens, but guess what? This year, I found my way back to the budget-friendly one! Why? It‚Äôs smaller and more lightweight, I handle it with less caution and ultimately it helped me to capture moments like these better.

Speaking of photography gear, did you know you can buy and sell equipment hassle-free at @MPBcom? Not only does it make photography more affordable, but it‚Äôs also a sustainable choice. I sold my high-end lens and bought myself a Fujifilm x100v (new photos coming soon). üì¶‚ú®

And here‚Äôs the cherry on top: MPB is proudly sponsoring the German Street Photography Festival at PHOTOPIA Hamburg. As part of the celebration, you have a chance to win a Fujifilm X100V camera. üéâ 

To enter the competition, just click the link in my bio. Good luck! üì∏üéÅ (Open to EU residents only.)

üé∞ Win tickets to the Photopia Festival in Hamburg ‚Äì read below! üéüÔ∏è

Here are some of my favorite street photography moments from different corners of the world.

These shots may vary in location and theme, but they all have one thing in common: they were captured using a telephoto lens, my favorite setup for street photography. 

Why, you ask? Because it allows me to observe life from a distance and flatten the depth of a photo, bringing clarity and crispness to the scene.

Speaking of street photography, something exciting is on the horizon: @mpbcom proudly sponsors the German Street Photography Festival at @photopia_ham in Hamburg (September 21st - 24th), and we're giving away tickets.

üé∞ How can you win two tickets? Leave a comment under this post and follow @mpbcom.

We're also curious to know if you have a favorite lens for street photography, but that's optional. Good luck! üçÄ

Giveaway closes on September 10th. Visit the link in my bio for the Terms & Conditions. Please note this is open to EU residents only.¬†
